intro: Verbascum tetuanense, commonly known as the Tetuan mullein, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its large, fuzzy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is well adapted to arid environments. It is often found in regions with Mediterranean climates, such as southern Spain and northern Africa. Verbascum tetuanense is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
